newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - July 11.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - July 11.

text.p: The Washington Post included the following items on the front page of its business section on Friday:
WASHINGTON - The future of Apple Computer Inc. does not look very bright after chief executive Gilbert Amelio resigned on Wednesday.

WASHINGTON - The Clinton administration, which once promoted the North American Free Trade Agreement as a major boon for American companies and workers, concluded in a report that NAFTA has had a "modest positive effect" on the U.S. economy.

WASHINGTON - If Congress approves the tobacco settlement announced last month, the law firms which defend cigarette companies worry that they could lose their share of an estimated $600 million spent every year fighting lawsuits filed against tobacco firms.
WASHINGTON - In the latest round of personal computer price wars, Compaq Computer Corp. said it will cut the prices of its desktop models by as much as 22 percent.
